isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - VEHICLE TOWING INSTRUCTIONS - REMOVE AXLE SHAFTS

step1.para: Identify each axle shaft so that they can be installed in the same location after repair is completed.
Remove capscrew* and washers or stud nuts* and washers from flanges of both axle shafts.
*Some Rockwell Carriers do not have the parts described.

note.para: A 1 - ½ inch diameter brass hammer can be used as a drift.

step1.para: Hit the end of the drift with a large hammer (five to six pounds) and the axle shaft and tapered dowels will loosen ( Figure 3).

figure.caption: Figure 3. Hit End of Drift With Large Hammer

caution.para: Do not use a chisel or wedge to loosen the axle shafts and dowels. The chisel or wedge can damage the hub, axle shafts and, if used, oil seals.

step1.para: Remove both axle shafts of drive axles that will remain on the ground while the vehicle is being towed.

note.para: If the axle(s) are equipped with main differential lock, the left-hand front axle shaft and right-hand rear axle shaft of tandem axles and the right-hand axle shaft of single axles have two sets of splines. One set of splines is engaged with the side gear and one set is engaged with the shift collar. It may be necessary to rotate the shaft when pulling it through the shift collar ( Figure 4) (single or rear of tandem axle shown).

figure.caption: Figure 4. May Have to Rotate Shaft When Pulling It Through Shift Collar
